values:
its the first post of 2007.










and probably the last.
Yay. It's my first update in the year 2006.

The drummer from Bayside, John Holohan, died this morning in a crash this morning after their van hit a patch of ice and rolled. Their bassist, Nick Ghanbarian, is in critical condition in the hospital. Pray for John and Nick's families. Thanks.

Wow. Bradley Hathaway is gorgeous. And a phenomenal poet. 






(and he has a lip ring)







...and i love bonfires under a clear sky of stars...

jack mansure can go on the fall retreat.   :D.

klajds;flkjads;al. WOW.

mogli 590:  if i were a guy youd probly make me turn gay evan.

bravo morgan trickett, bravo.

I'll try my best to come tomorrow night, but due to football endings ranging from 6:30-7:45, I have no idea what time I'd be there. Either way, I'm going to try.

Shalom.

So the first day of high school was actually really cool. I have a lot of classes with some sophomores that I know and I'm really glad to get a chance to break away from my previous freshmen friends (not saying names) though I still enjoy hanging out with a select few.  

I prayed for everyone last night, so I hope that everyone's day was alright today.  Don't worry, we'll get through this year.

And Spencer Chamberlain is totally wearing a Jedidiah shirt and wrist band in my lj icon...SWEET.
He Is Legend rocks my face off.

5 new cds:

Copeland- Know Nothing Stays The Same
JamisonParker- Sleepwalker
Lovedrug- Pretend You're Alive
Straylight Run- Straylight Run
Weezer- Weezer

All PHENOMENAL CDs and I highly recommend all of them.

"I lay as this sacrifice to this unholy altar
The evil inside Satan; Satan sit and watch me die
Demented screams, tortured beings, where's your hope,
where's your smile, there was none
Life of lies gone, gone no more
So upset, so distraught, I'm sorry, I'm Sorry... I live for the Lord
Watch me die no longer I am alive
My purpose no more... I live for Christ
Dead to sin, only begin, imagine what's for Soldier of Christ
Changed with a new beginning, blood of the lamb, white washed sins
Forgive me God for all of these years of my transgressions
I cry renewed, I cry renewed This world means nothing to me
My life changed I now see Crucified with Christ,
the old self left with the rest of this world, rest of this world
Kneel before his throne, home now from this journey
I see my father in his arms finally found
This path I have chosen is hard but I'll make it with my saviors help
I survive this hell till the end I'll stand true
Eternal life, ready for the fight that the evil brings
No giving in... I'm free
The fire burns engulfing all the victims in it's path, no where to run
Over taken they give in to surrender to the Lord once, and for all
No longer keeping quiet, no longer standing still,
no longer giving in, no longer going back
I stand strong praying for love always to be in my heart"

-"Watch Me Die"   ...and some people had doubts that Underoath was Christian...
So I've officially got THE best icon EVER. Matt Thiessen's picture from his profile on purevolume.com with Matthew Thiessen & The Earthquakes. I think he looks awesome.

Upcoming CD's/News:

David Crowder Band- September 27- "A Collision"

Switchfoot- September 13- "Nothing Is Sound"

Sanctus Real- March, 2006- "Untitled So-Far"

Falling Up- October, 2005- "Dawn Escapes"

Blindside- August 2- "The Great Depression"

...and I'm sure you've all heard about the new John Reuben, Paul Wright, TFK, and other cds coming out in the month of July, so I won't bother naming those.


In an upcoming movie, "Yours, Mine, & Ours" coming out this November, Hawk Nelson is in the movie playing a live song "Things We Go Through"




Alright, so I hadn't updated in awhile, and now I have.  I probably won't for a long time, so...shalom.
...Your lips provide a shelter for the things that I don't know; please speak slowly, my heart is learning, teach me heartache, stop this burning now..."

So the new Batman movie is one of the best movies I've seen in the past year.  I highly recommend it, even to people who don't like Batman particularly.  Very good, very good.

I'll be packing up tomorrow afternoon once I get home from church, and I don't think I have the list of things to take. I have one list, but there's another list that came with the packet that my mom lost. Whatever. I might borrow yours, Julia. K? Cool.

People who aren't coming (everybody except Julia, Mo Trick, and Anna), I'll miss y'all.  For real.

Dear readers:
I'm sorry for the confusion between me and girls at the church. Please know that I'm not trying to start a dating relationship with any of them, nor am I doing this so-called "flirting". If you have a problem with me going on a walk with one of them, know that we talk about heaven and the like. I'm also sorry to the girl if I'm stirred up any emotions, but those of you who people have talked about us, we've talked about this subject and we should be all cool with it. If anybody wants to talk about it, please talk to me. Don't talk to anybody else about it, please talk to me. Thank you. 
Sincerely, Evan



(MTers, I'm very happy to see all of you once again.)
My house. Tomorrow night. 7:00 P.M. Enough said.

CREATE YOUR OWN! - or - GET PAID TO TAKE SURVEYS!

Went to Gaffney today for like 2 hours and hung out at The Bible Factory by myself.  It was really fun.  I got C.S. Lewis's "Mere Christianity", and John Eldredge's "The Sacred Romance", Switchfoot: Learning To Breathe, Exit East: Exit East, Andy Hunter: Exodus, 5 WWJD Bracelets, all black because that was the only color they had, I got one for Morgan Hill, Ashley, and Leslie, and I have one left over for somebody else if they wanna claim it.  And I got two signs for my room.  So I'm set.

Saw a movie tonight...:-/. hahaha.

Church tomorrow. Weeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee...

Went for a run today before swim practice...not a good idea.  I was really tired during practice.  But whatever, it still doesn't compare to Morgan Hill and Trickett's practices, dang. Y'all are hardcore.  
 
Speaking about comparing....
 
"I consider that our present sufferings are not worth comparing with the glory that will be revealed in us.  The creation waits in eager expectation for the sons of God to be revealed. For the creation was subjected to frustration, not by its own choice, but by the will of the one who subjected it, in hope that the creation itself will be liberated from its bondage to decay and brought into the glorious freedom of the children of God."
Romans 8:18-21 NIV
 
"That's why I don't think there's any comparison between the present hard times and the coming good times. The created world itself can hardly wait for what's coming next.  Everything in creation is being more or less held back.  God reins it in until both creation and all the creatures are ready and can be released at the same moment into the glorious times ahead.  Meanwhile, the joyful anticipation deepens."
Romans 8:18-21 (The Message: Remix)
 
"In your struggle against sin, you have not yet resisted to the point of shedding your blood. And you have forgotten that word of encouragement that addresses you as sons:"
Hebrews 12:4-5a NIV
 
"In this all-out match against sin, others have suffered far worse than you, to say nothing of what Jesus went through-all that bloodshed! So don't feel sorry for yourselves. Or have you forgotten how good parents treat children, and that God regards you as his children?"
Hebrews 12:4-5a (The Message: Remix)
 
    Those are all really hott 'cause it's something to look forward to when we're struggling, thinking that when we're struggling, we haven't yet begun to suffer so badly as to bleed like our Jesus did for us.  So next time you think you're struggling with sin, or with temptation, or with persecution, just think of the glory that will soon be revealed to us.  Look ahead to the rewards you'll have in heaven if you just pass up this one temptation and stuff.  Just think.

So my mom said that since my dad's going to Miami tomorrow morning, and Davis is gone, and my WWJD bracelet broke, she might take me to the Gaffney outlets and to the Bible store there where I got my last WWJD braclet on Friday, so if anybody wants one, just tell me and I'll get you one.  Tell me if you want one and tell me the color.

ajfds;ksdfkl;AHHHH I KNEW IT. 

ok, so remember how i said further seems forever's "snowbirds and townies" sounds EXACTLY like dashboard confessional?! wellllllll boys and girls, on that album, the lead singer was chris carrabba, who left the band before the release of the album to start the band now known as dashboard confessional.  so it WAS him. ajdsfkl;jdsafkl;jdsaf. i'm so good with music.

I'm back kids.




Goo! I was just looking on jesusfreakhideout.com, a place for Christian CD reviews, and AMBER PACIFIC was on there!!!!!! Caro, Amber Pacific. jasdfkl;jdsafkl;dsaf;ad.


Andrew, I got The Killers cd.

Guys going to the lock-in, come to my house at 7 tonight and hang out till 11 when we go to the lock-in.


Just guys at my house at 7, sorry gals.  But...gals meet the guys at 7:30 at the Moe's on Augusta and we'll all hang out and have dinner.
If anybody likes Dashboard Confessional or Spill Canvas, go to purevolume.com and look up Further Seems Forever, and listen to "Snowbirds and Townies."  You should like it.

Went to bed last night at 10 P.M.  Woke up at 11 A.M.  That's right, 13 hours of sleep boys and girls.  I need it for tonight...LOCK-IN.

Tonight should be really fun.  Good luck Morgan Trickett and I'll be sitting right in front of you, as you wished.

For those of you not going to the lock-in; Steph, Kate, Elizabeth, Morgan, Kathryn, Carolyn, so on and so forth, I'll see y'all next Sunday.  I love you all.
Last night was really really fun.  I tell you what, the Count of Monte Cristo is one of my favorites movies ever...it's sooo good.
Farewell Hughes Academy of Science and Technology...

Last day of school.

Then football for around 3 hours.

Then the pool.

Then CHURCH!!!!!asdfjkl;fj.

Then my first non-school night during the school week.

Oh boy.

So today was wonderful.

School was easy as anything, two open-notes exams.

Then cut the grass for an hour and met Julia and Laura at the pool to hang out for almost 3 hours, then afterwards Kate and Julia showed up in my front yard and I came out and talked to them.  Then Kate and I walked Julia home to meet Laura and Anna, which I was very excited to see Anna.

Then I walked Kate home and we stopped in her front yard and sat down and her mom greeted us and left the front door open so we talked for a really long time about our relationships with God and our relationships with people and how hard it is to live up to the standards that we set for ourselves and that Jesus set for us, but it'd be so awesome if we could live up to it.  Then we prayed. :-D.

Dear Julia,
Thanks for hanging out with me
at the pool today.  And for coming
to see me in my front yard.  And 
once again, I'm ecstatic that you 
have those feelings about things 
at the pool; like little things like 
wearing your shorts in.  It's awesome.
I respect that.  And please tell 
me if you want to change anything.
I love you.  We should hang out 
this summer a whole lot.  And since
we've already established you're my
pool buddy, we'll just have a 
kickin' time at GCC.  Wonderful.
Love, Evan.

Dear Kate,
Thank you for being you.  You're 
such a beautiful girl and you 
have such a beautiful heart.  Thank 
you for being gentle, even with people
like Jackson Midget and Jack Black.
I thank my God everytime I remember
you in my prayers.  Thank you for
talking to me today, and thank you for
praying with me.  I prayed on the way
home by myself and I thanked Him 
several times for you.  You're amazing.
I love you. 
Love, Evan

Overall very exciting/busy weekend.  I was out doing something the whole time.

I'm really glad I got to know Kate and Elizabeth better this weekend, that was fun.  Even if it did involve getting into my feminine side (drawing girly signs) I enjoyed it greatly.

Waffle House is so cool.  Went tonight again.

I'm ready to just chill tomorrow...

"Another week away, my greatest fear. 
I need the smell of summer, 
I need its noises in my ears."

-Brand New

Last full day of school today.  Then three half days.  Geometry test today.  Then I'm not worrying about school again until next year.

I enjoyed seeing y'all last night.  Every one of you.

"Please don't give up when it's easy
Don't you know that me and Jesus will cheer you on?
He's the only one who will be constantly everything you need."

-Mae: Tisbury Lane



It's almost SUMMER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
NEW PAUL WRIGHT CD OUT JULY 19TH!!!!!!!!!

When I made up my mind
And my heart along with that
To live not for myself
But yet for God, somebody said
Do you know what you are getting yourself into

When I finally ironed out
All of my priorities
And asked God to remove the doubt
That makes me so unsure of these
Things I ask myself, I ask myself
Do you know what you are getting yourself into

I'm getting into you 
Because you got to me, in a way words can't describe
I'm getting into you 
Because I've got to be
You're essential to survive
I'm going to love you with my life

When he looked at me and said
I kind of view you as a son
And for a second our eyes met
And I met that with a question
Do you know what you are getting yourself into

I've been a liar and I'll never amount to
The kind of person you deserve to worship you
You say you will not dwell on what I did but rather what I do you say
I love you and that's what you are getting yourself into

He said, I love you and that's what you are getting yourself into.


Man, I have trouble getting rid of the past.  I need to clear my mind.

Okay so everybody go to johnreuben.com and join the mailing list.  BUT WHEN YOU DO, WHERE IT SAYS REFER ID #, PUT 32211.  THAT'S ME AND IF I GET ENOUGH PEOPLE, THEN I GET A PRIZE PACK. PLEEEASE, EVERYBODY DO IT.

Andrew, I found this Calibretto song, and I'm dedicating it to you for your graduation. 

"You go right. I'll go left. 
Sometimes we don't agree 
But that's ok, cuz' in the end 
We're still brothers, you and me. 
We'll go to Steak n' Shake(Moe's in our case) sometimes, 
Cuz we hang out every night 
And we do the same ol' thing. 
Sometimes we fool around too much, 
Cuz' we are a frisky bunch. 
We get in trouble everyday. 
Hey! Ho! Straight through the heart 
I'm for you, and I know you're there for me. 
Give me a High 5! 
Hey! Ho! Friends till the end 
Can't you see that's the way it's got to be 
You're the money and the bomb, 
But I talk about your mom 
Even though it isn't right. 
Go to Mikey's (Story's in our case) play some games, 
Stay up till the break of day, 
Maybe get into a fight. 
Even though we're hittin' 20 (different ages in our case)
And we haven't yet matured, (and yes, we actually have.)
You know I think it's kinda funny 
That we're all a bunch of nerds. 
Can't you see God has destined us to be."

That was insanely cheesy for one guy to another.  But that's ok.

'Because'

Because of You,
my heart beats. 
my soul faints, 
my body thirsts, 
my lungs breathe, 
my feet dance, 
my hands rise,
my knees fall, 
and my tounge sings praise. 
Becuase of You, 
the heaven's sing, 
the devil runs, 
the darkness flees, 
the blind see, 
the deaf hear, 
the weak dance, 
the hungry feast, 
the flowers sing, 
the sun sets, 
the mountains roar, 
and the rain falls. 

-Anonymous
Oooooh snap.  John Reuben.  New CD.  "The Boy vs. The Cynic." 6.21.05.  Guest appearance from Matt Thiessen.  Dang.

English 1 E.O.C. earlier this morning.  Took 45 minutes on it and thought it was pretty easy, but we took it in the cafeteria so it was oober uncomfy.  I can't WAIT for the weekend.  And for the school year to be out.

Football game should be cancelled tonight considering Sirrine Stadium is like a freaking bowl for the water to go in.  I reeeeeally want to go to the game though.  And even if it is cancelled, I'm not sure I want to go to the Klaver Dance anyways.

I want to do something this weekend.  With friends.  And especially go to Moe's.  I haven't had it in over a week...I think I'm going to die.  Maybe if the game gets cancelled, Andrew you wanna have dinner at Moe's?

ja;sldfjasl;fj. school.

dear morgan h,
you're awesome.
thank you for opening
up to me.  i'm here
for you.  i love you.
i'm praying. 
love, evan.

Random lyrics from the new Deepspace CD:

"I love to put the talk in my music to God bless, 'cause I want to touch the fans like Ron Artest" 

"They say the bigger you are, the harder you thud.  Sometimes you're the windshield, sometimes you're the bug"

"I grip the handle of this sawed-off verse, shotgun splatter my brain matter with every burst"

"I speak in brief words, this grief observed, and make rap something more than just vanity slurs"

Those are very few.  When I listen to the CD more, I'll put more lyrics on there.

We watched The Princess Bride after our PACT testing today.  Gosh I love that movie.

"My goals are what 
they should be but 
my mind will have to change 
and see things another way 

I'll be taking a bull by the horns 
take the action in this world 
Jumping into the ring 
and taking control of everything 

The blame I'm not thinking that's me of course 
I look in the mirror and I see the source 
spot my problems gonna change my ways 
I need God's love I need his grace 
I'm gonna change my ways- yeah yeah today 

Once again 
I've fallen into sin 
it's like quicksand around my soul 
the more I struggle the stronger it holds 
onto me I want to be free 
want to be able to see 
that there's another way 
if I check myself to day I want to 

Take a bull by the horns 
And take some action in this world 
Jumping into the ring 
and take control of everything 

The blame I'm not thinking thatss me of course 
I look in the mirror and I see the source 
spot my problems gonna change my ways 
I need God's love I need his grace 
I'm gonna change my ways- yeah yeah today"

-Relient K: "My Cape Is Stuck In The Phone Booth"
Please pray for Cynthia, she's having anterior cervical fusion (surgery on her neck) today.
